department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: Three panel huipil with square-cut neck opening; center panel is completely covered with supplementary weft patterning or embroidery predominantly in red with blue, green and purple accents, rows of geometric figures, triangles, zigzags, crosses, etc.; side panels have white ground and rows of geometric patterning in same colors as center.
title: Woman's Cofrad√≠a blouse (Huipil)
